title: E-Waste Collection and Recycling Distribution
content: A recycling company operates a fleet of trucks to deliver new electronics (linehaul) to retailers while collecting e-waste (backhaul) for safe disposal. Each truck (capacity: `<capacity>`) departs from the recycling center (`<loc_depot>`) and must visit `<num_customer>` locations (`<loc_customer>`). Retailers have strict delivery windows (`<time_windows>`) for new stock, while e-waste pickups must occur before noon due to environmental regulations. Routes are constrained by a maximum shift duration (`<time_limit>`), and trucks must complete all deliveries before pickups. The goal is to minimize total emissions while meeting time and capacity constraints.

title: Florist Chain Freshness-First Routing
content: A florist network with a central greenhouse (`<loc_depot>`) supplies fresh flowers to `<num_customer>` boutique shops (`<loc_customer>`) and retrieves wilted inventory (backhaul) for composting. Each shop has a narrow morning delivery window (`<time_windows>`) to ensure peak freshness, and trucks (capacity: `<capacity>`) must return to the depot within `<time_limit>` hours to avoid flower spoilage. Deliveries (linehaul) must precede pickups (backhaul), and routes must balance perishability constraints with fuel efficiency.

title: Vaccine and Medical Waste Logistics
content: A healthcare provider distributes temperature-sensitive vaccines (linehaul) to clinics (`<loc_customer>`) and collects used syringes (backhaul) for incineration. Clinics have rigid time windows (`<time_windows>`) for vaccine deliveries (e.g., during staff shifts), and refrigerated trucks (capacity: `<capacity>`) must return to `<loc_depot>` within `<time_limit>` hours to maintain cold-chain integrity. Backhaul pickups can only occur after all deliveries are complete. The objective is to maximize on-time deliveries while minimizing exposure risk during waste transport.

title: Farm-to-Table Produce and Packaging Returns
content: A cooperative delivers fresh produce (linehaul) from a central farm (`<loc_depot>`) to `<num_customer>` restaurants (`<loc_customer>`) and retrieves empty crates (backhaul) for reuse. title: Library Bookmobile and Donation Collection
content: A mobile library service delivers reserved books (linehaul) to `<num_customer>` neighborhoods (`<loc_customer>`) and collects book donations (backhaul) for processing. title: Perishable Seafood Delivery and Shell Recycling
content: A seafood distributor delivers fresh catches to restaurants (<loc_customer>) from a central hub (<loc_depot>) using refrigerated trucks (capacity: <capacity>). content:

title: Medical Lab Specimen Courier Network
content:

title: Reverse Logistics for Electronics Retailer
content:

title: Municipal Tree Pruning and Biomass Collection
content:

content:
